column3: Garment may be laundered through the use of hottest available water, detergent or soap, agitation, and a machine designed for this purpose.
column5: SYSTEM OF DOTS INDICATING TEMPERATURE RANGE IS THE SAME FOR ALL WASH PROCEDURES.

column3: Initial water temperature should not exceed 30C or 65 to 85F.
column5: SYSTEM OF DOTS INDICATING TEMPERATURE RANGE IS THE SAME FOR ALL WASH PROCEDURES.

column3: Initial water temperature should not exceed 40C or 105F.
column5: SYSTEM OF DOTS INDICATING TEMPERATURE RANGE IS THE SAME FOR ALL WASH PROCEDURES.

column3: Initial water temperature should not exceed 50C or 120F.
column5: SYSTEM OF DOTS INDICATING TEMPERATURE RANGE IS THE SAME FOR ALL WASH PROCEDURES.

column3: Initial water temperature should not exceed 60C or 140F.
column5: SYSTEM OF DOTS INDICATING TEMPERATURE RANGE IS THE SAME FOR ALL WASH PROCEDURES.

column3: Initial water temperature should not exceed 70C or 160F.

column3: Initial water temperature should not exceed 95C or 200F.

column3: Garment may be machine laundered only on the setting designed to preserve Permanent Press with cool down or cold rinse prior to reduced spin.
Garment may be machine laundered only on the setting designed for gentle agitation and/or reduced time for delicate items.
Garment may be laundered through the use of water, detergent or soap and gentle hand manipulation.
Garment may not be safely laundered by any process. Normally accompanied by Dry Clean instructions.
Any commercially available bleach product may be used in the laundering process.
column5: All (98+%) washable textiles are safe in some type of bleach. IF BLEACH IS NOT MENTIONED OR REPRESENTED BY A SYMBOL, ANY BLEACH MAY BE USED.

column3: Only a non-chlorine, color-safe bleach may be used in the laundering process. Chlorine bleach may not be used.
column5: All (98+%) washable textiles are safe in some type of bleach. IF BLEACH IS NOT MENTIONED OR REPRESENTED BY A SYMBOL, ANY BLEACH MAY BE USED.

column3: No bleach product may be used. The garment is not colorfast or structurally able to withstand any bleach.
column5: All (98+%) washable textiles are safe in some type of bleach. IF BLEACH IS NOT MENTIONED OR REPRESENTED BY A SYMBOL, ANY BLEACH MAY BE USED.

column3: A machine dryer may be regularly used at the hottest available temperature setting.
column5: SYSTEM OF DOTS INDICATING TEMPERATURE RANGE IS THE SAME FOR ALL DRY PROCEDURES.

column3: A machine dryer may be regularly used at a maximum of Low Heat setting.
column5: SYSTEM OF DOTS INDICATING TEMPERATURE RANGE IS THE SAME FOR ALL DRY PROCEDURES.

column3: A machine dryer may be regularly used at a maximum of Medium Heat setting.
column5: SYSTEM OF DOTS INDICATING TEMPERATURE RANGE IS THE SAME FOR ALL DRY PROCEDURES.

column3: A machine dryer may be regularly used at a High Heat setting.
column5: SYSTEM OF DOTS INDICATING TEMPERATURE RANGE IS THE SAME FOR ALL DRY PROCEDURES.

column3: A machine dryer may be regularly used only at No Heat or Air Only setting.
column5: SYSTEM OF DOTS INDICATING TEMPERATURE RANGE IS THE SAME FOR ALL DRY PROCEDURES.

column3: A machine dryer may be regularly used only at the Permanent Press setting.
A machine dryer may be regularly used only at the Gentle setting.
A machine dryer may not be used. Usually accompanied by an alternate drying method symbol.
A machine dryer may not be used. Usually accompanied by an alternate drying method symbol.
Hang damp garment from line or bar, in or out doors.
Hang dripping wet garment from line or bar, in or out doors, without hand shaping or smoothing.
Lay out horizontally for drying.
Usually added to Line or Drip Dry. Dry away from direct sunlight.
Do not Wring.

column2: Iron, Any Temperature, Steam or Dry
column3: Regular ironing may be needed and may be performed at any available temperature with or without steam is acceptable.
column5: IF IRONING IS NOT A NECESSARY, REGULAR CARE PROCEDURE IT NEED NOT BE MENTIONED.

column3: Regular ironing, steam or dry, may be performed at Low setting (110C, 230F) only.
column5: IF IRONING IS NOT A NECESSARY, REGULAR CARE PROCEDURE IT NEED NOT BE MENTIONED.

column3: Regular ironing, steam or dry, may be performed at Medium setting (150C, 300F).
column5: IF IRONING IS NOT A NECESSARY, REGULAR CARE PROCEDURE IT NEED NOT BE MENTIONED.

column3: Regular ironing, steam or dry, may be performed at High setting (200C, 290F).
column5: IF IRONING IS NOT A NECESSARY, REGULAR CARE PROCEDURE IT NEED NOT BE MENTIONED.

column3: Steam ironing will harm garment, but regular dry ironing at indicated temperature setting is acceptable.
column5: SYSTEM OF DOTS INDICATING TEMPERATURE RANGE IS THE SAME FOR ALL IRONING PROCEDURES.

column3: Item may not be smoothed or finished with an iron.
column5: SYSTEM OF DOTS INDICATING TEMPERATURE RANGE IS THE SAME FOR ALL IRONING PROCEDURES.
